head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 18 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: An imperfect extract; Questions addressed by the orthodox to the partizans of the Council of Chalcedon; Questions addressed by one person to another; An extract regardingEusebius of DorylaeumandEutyches, and the deposition of the latter by the Council of Chalcedon. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 4 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: An imperfect extract
Questions addressed by the orthodox to the partizans of the Council of Chalcedon
Questions addressed by one person to another
msItem.incipit: ܟܠ ܕܫ̣ܘܐ ܒܫܡܐ ܫ̣ܘܐ ܒܐܘܣܝܐ̣܀ ܠܐ ܡܛܠ ܡܢܐ܀ ܟܠܒܐ ܕܓܢܒܪܐ ܘܟܠܒܐ ܕܝܡܐ ܘܟܠܒܐ ܕܝܒܫܐ ܫܘܝܢ ܒܫܡܐ̣. ܒܐܘܣܝܐ ܕܝܢ ܡܫܚܠܦܝܢ܀ ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: An extract regarding Eusebius of Dorylaeum and Eutyches, and the deposition of the latter by the Council of Chalcedon

physDesc.p: Four vellum leaves, about 7 1/8 in. by 5 1/4, much soiled and torn, with 28 or 29 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is small and regular, of the ixth or xth cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Extracts which belonged to a volume entitled "The Book of the Philosophers. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 3 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Extracts which belonged to a volume entitled "The Book of the Philosophers
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ ܚܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܢ ܝܫܘܥ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܡ̇ܫܪܝܢܢ ܕܢܟܬܘܒ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܦܝ̈ܠܣܘܦܐ

msItem.title: On οὐσία
msItem.incipit: ܡܡܠܠܐ ܏ܟܝܢܝܐ ܏ܕܦܝܠܣܘܦܐ: ܐܡܬܝ ܕܫ̇ܡܥ ܐܢܬ ܐܘܣܝܐ̣ ܗܟܢܐ ܐܣܬ̇ܟܠ. ܕܟܠܡܕܡ ܕܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܩܢܘܡܐ ܘܡ̣ܩܝܡ̣ ܐܘܣܝܐ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ. ܐܢ ܒܢܝ̈ܢܫܐ ܘܐܢ ܚܝ̈ܘܬܐ ܘܐܢ ܢܨܒ̈ܬܐ ܘܐܢ ܢܘ̈ܢܐ. ܘܐܢ ܟܐ̈ܦܐ ܘܐܢ ܫ̈ܐܕܐ. ܘܐܢ ܡ̈ܠܐܟܐ ܘܐܢ ܢܦܫ̈ܬܐ. ܘܗ̣ܘ ܟܝܢܐ ܕܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ̣ ܐܘܣܝܐ ܡܬܐܡܪ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: On εἶδος
msItem.incipit: ܡܛܠ ܏ܐܕܫܐ. ܐܕܫܐ ܕܝܢ ܡܬܐܡܪ ܡ̣̇ܢ ܘܥܠ ܕܡܘܼܬܐ ܕܟܠ ܚܕ. ܐܝܟ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܐܡܝܪܐ܇ ܩܕܡܐܝܬ ܡ̇ܢ ܗܘܼ ܐܕܫܗ ܫ̇ܘܐ ܠܡܠܟܘܬܐ. ܡܬܐܡܪ ܕܝܢ ܐܕܫܐ̣ ܐܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܬܚܝܬ ܓܢܣܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܐܬܝܗ̇ܒ ܏ܘܫ.

physDesc.p: Two vellum leaves, 7 3/8 in. by 5 3/8. There are 22 or 23 lines in each page.

layout.p: There are 22 or 23 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: Two vellum leaves written in a neat, regular hand, and dated A. Gr. 1150, A.D. 839

item.label: Colophon
item.p: On fol. 5 a there is a note, stating that the manuscript was written, at the date above mentioned, by Arabi, a monk of the convent of Ḳarḳaphtā, or "the Skull," for the deacon Ishai bar Ḥabīb, of the village of Ramīn near Māridīn.

p.quote: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܦܝ̈ܠܣܘܦܐ ܕܐܝܫܝ ܡܫܡܫܢܐ ܒܪ ܚܒܝܒ܇ ܕܡܢ ܪܡܝܢ ܩܪܝܬܐ ܕܒܫܘܠܛܢܐ ܕܡܪܕܐ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ. ܕܐܬܚ̇ܦܛ ܘܩܢܝܗܝ ܐܝܟ ܕܠܝܘܬܪܢܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܟܝܬ݂ ܘܐܦ ܕܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܦ̇ܓܥܝܢ. ܏ܘܫ. ܐܫ̇ܬܠܡ ܕܝܢ ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦܐ ܘܡܐܐ ܘܚܡܫܝܢ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܘܣ ܒܐܝܪܚ ܢܝܣܢ ܒܫܒܥܐ ܒܗ ܝܘܡ ܚܕܒܫܒܐ. ܒܥܘܡܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܩܪܩܦܬܐ (sic) ܟܬܒܗ̣ ܕܝܢ ܐܪܐܒܝ ܡܣܟܢܐ ܡܢܗ ܕܥܘܡܪܐ ܕܐܡܝܪ ܐܝܟ ܚܝܠܐ ܕܠܗ ܐܬܝܗܒ.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Dioscorus. The commencement of a letter ofDioscorustoDomnus, bishop ofAntioch. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: The commencement of a letter of Dioscorus to Domnus, bishop of Antioch
msItem.incipit: ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܐܬܝܗܒܬ ܡܢ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܕܝܣܩܪܘܣ ܠܕܚܠ ܠܐܠܗܐ ܕܘܡܢܘܣ ܐܦܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܐܢܛܝܟܝܐ.

layout.p: The more ancient text is written in double columns.

handDesc.handNote: The more ancient text is written in an elegant Esṭrangĕlā of the vith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Philosophical and theological disquisitions, partly in the form of a dialogue, the interlocutors being distinguished as ܐ (ܐܖ,fol. 9 b, line 5; ܐܪ,fol. 11 a, line 4) and ܗ.; Cyril of Alexandria. Extracts from Cyril of Alexandria; Theophilus the Persian. Extracts from Theophilus the Persian; Ephraim. Extracts from Ephraim; Four leaves, without rubrics, treating of the terms ܟܝܢܐ , ܓܢܣܐ , ܐܕܫܐ , and especially ܩܢܘܡܐ. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 12 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Philosophical and theological disquisitions, partly in the form of a dialogue, the interlocutors being distinguished as ܐ (ܐܖ,fol. 9 b, line 5; ܐܪ,fol. 11 a, line 4) and ܗ.
msItem.note: Some of the rubrics are effaced, but others are still legible.

msItem.title: Whether God became incarnate
Unspecified philosophical or theological disquisition with illegible heading
On the soul

msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܕܝܠܗ ܒܙܢܐ ܐܚܪܢܐ ܕܥܠ ܢܦـ[ـܫܐ]

msItem.title: On the union of the soul with the body
That the soul is made, or created

msItem.note: Imperfect rubric, only the last word remains.

msItem.title: Extracts from Cyril of Alexandria
Extracts from Theophilus the Persian
msItem.note: Cf. Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. iii., pars 1, p. 42

msItem.title: Extracts from Ephraim
Four leaves, without rubrics, treating of the terms ܟܝܢܐ , ܓܢܣܐ , ܐܕܫܐ , and especially ܩܢܘܡܐ.

physDesc.p: Thirteen vellum leaves, about 7 7/8 in. by 5 1/2, nearly all more or less stained and torn (Add. 17,215, foll. 9—21). There are from 30 to 36 lines in each page.

item.p: All leaves more or less stained and torn

layout.p: There are from 30 to 36 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: A neatly written, apparently Nestorian, manuscript of the ixth or xth cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Prayers for the evening, ܕܪܡܫܐ and night, ܨ̈ܠܘܬܐ ܕܠܠܝܐ; Basil. A prayer of Basil; Jacob of Edessa. On the Signs of the Cross made during the celebration of the holy Eucharist; A prayer at the conclusion of any service; Questions addressed byAddai the priesttoJacob of Edessa. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 5 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Prayers for the evening, ܕܪܡܫܐ and night, ܨ̈ܠܘܬܐ ܕܠܠܝܐ
A prayer of Basil
On the Signs of the Cross made during the celebration of the holy Eucharist
msItem.rubric: ܨ̈ܠܝܒܐ ܕܡܬܥܒܕܝܢ ܒܩܘܪܒܐ ܕܟܡܐ ܗܘ̈ܝܢ ܕܡ̈ܛܟܣܝܢ ܠܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܐܘܪܗܝܐ

msItem.title: A prayer at the conclusion of any service
Questions addressed by Addai the priest to Jacob of Edessa
msItem.rubric: ܫ̈ܘܐܠܐ ܕܫܐܠ ܩܫܝܫܐ ܐܕܝ ܪܚ̇ܡ ܥܡܠܐ. ܠܚܣܝܐ ܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܕܐܘܪܗܝ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ: ܘܥܒ̣ܕ ܠܗ ܦܘܢܝ ܦܬܓܡܐ
msItem.note: Cf. De Lagarde, Reliquiae Juris Eccles. Antiq., p. ܩܝܙ ; Lamy, Dissert, de Syrorum fide et disciplina in re Eucharist., p. 98

layout.p: There are from 26 to 29 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is good and regular, of the xth or xith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Nilus. Two portions of the discourse of Nilus on virtuous conduct. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Two portions of the discourse of Nilus on virtuous conduct
msItem.rubric: ܫܪܒܐ ܕܐܡܝܪ ܠܢܝܠܘܣ ܝܚܝܕܝܐ ܥܠ ܕܘܒܪ̈ܐ ܕܡܝܬܪܘܬܐ
msItem.incipit: ܡܛܠ ܦܘܠܚܢܐ (ܕ)ܕܝܪܝܘܬܐ ܐܘ ܐܚܘܢ: ܘܕܐܝܟܢܐ ܙܕܩ̇ ܠܗܘܢ ܠܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܬܝ̇ܢ ܠܫܘܥܒܕܐ ܕܢܬܕܒܪܘܢ̣ ܘܕܐܝܟ ܐܝܢܐ ܘܕܐܝܟܢܐ ܙܕܩ̇ ܠܗ ܠܡܕܒܪܢܐ ܠܡܗܘܐ ܒܥܘܡܪܐ ܕܐܚ̈ܐ: ܐܦܝܣܬܢܝ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܠܟ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.note: The writing on the recto of the first leaf is almost illegible.
Cf. Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. iii., pars 1, p. 48

physDesc.p: Two vellum leaves, 6 in. by 4 1/8, both much soiled and torn, with from 22 to 24 lines in each page.

item.p: Both leaves are much soiled and torn.
The writing on the recto of the first leaf is almost illegible.

layout.p: There are from 22 to 24 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is a good, current hand of the xth cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Part of a theological treatise. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Part of a theological treatise
msItem.quote: ܡܟܬܒܢܘܬܗ ܕܡܬܝ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܗ̣ܘܬ ܨܝܕ ܥܒ̈ܪܝܐ
msItem.note: The heresies of Marcion, Mani, and Bardesanes, are discussed on the first leaf, and the Gospel of the Hebrews is mentioned.
The greater part of the writing on the verso of the last leaf has been, effaced, to make room for the concluding words of the Gospel of S. Mark, ch. xvi. 19, 20 .

physDesc.p: Four vellum leaves, all more or less stained and torn, with from 22 to 28 lines in each page.

item.p: Four vellum leaves, all more or less stained and torn.

layout.p: There are from 22 to 28 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: The leaves are written in a good hand of the viith or viiith cent.
The greater part of the writing on the verso of the last leaf has been, effaced, to make room for the concluding words of the Gospel of S. Mark, ch. xvi. 19, 20.

item.p: The greater part of the writing on the verso of the last leaf has been, effaced, to make room for the concluding words of the Gospel of S. Mark, ch. xvi. 19, 20.

head.note: This manuscript contains: A fly-leaf with note on the verso. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: A fly-leaf with note on the verso
msItem.incipit: ܟܠ ܕܝܢ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܢܥܒ̣ܕ ܚܘܒܐ ܒܦܪܘܫܘܬܐ. ܘܢܨ̇ܠܐ ܥܠ ܚܛܝܐ ܘܕܘ݁ܝܐ ܕܣ̣ܪܛ ܣܘܪ̈ܓܕܐ ܗܠܝܢ ܐܝܟ ܕܠܥܘܗܕܢܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

physDesc.p: Vellum leaf, about 7 1/8 in. by 6. A fly-leaf for the manuscript Add. 17,215, foll. 36-43 .

handDesc.handNote: Fol. 35 was a fly-leaf, and contains on the verso a note

head.note: This manuscript contains: Jacob of Batnae. Discourses of Jacob of Batnae; Philoxenus of Mabūg. An extract from Philoxenus of Mabūg on Virginity. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 4 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Discourses of Jacob of Batnae
On the End of the World and the Last Judgment
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܚܪܬܐ ܘܕܝܢ̣ܐ ܕܣܝܡ ܠܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܡܠܦܢܐ

msItem.title: On Strangers
msItem.incipit: ܒܚܕ ܡܢ ܝܘ̈ܡܝܢ ܟܕ ܥ̇ܒܪ ܐܢܐ ܒܫܘ̈ܩܝ ܥܠܡܐ̣. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: An extract from Philoxenus of Mabūg on Virginity
msItem.incipit: ܐܝܢܐ ܕܐܝܬ ܒܢ ܒܬܘܠܐ܆ ܢܙܕܗܪ ܒܠܡܦܐܕ ܒܬܘܠܘܬܗ̣. ܕܠܡܐ ܒܚܕܐ ܡܢ ܪ̈ܘܚܐ ܕܪ̈ܓܝܓܬܐ̇. ܢ̇ܕܥܟ ܫܪܓܗ ܢܗܝܪܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

physDesc.p: Nine vellum leaves, about 7 1/8 in. by 6, one of which is slightly torn (Add. 17,215, foll. 35—43), with from 22 to 25 lines in each page. There are lacunae after foll. 35, 41, and 42.

item.p: One leaf is slightly torn. There are lacunae after foll. 35, 41, and 42.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is inelegant, of the xth or xith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: The last leaf of a vellum manuscript containing, on the one side, a few words of the text, and the subscription. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: The last leaf of a vellum manuscript containing, on the one side, a few words of the text, and the subscription.
msItem.quote: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܥܡ ܟܠܗܘܢ ܫܪ̈ܒܘܗܝ ܦܩܘܕܘܢ ܡܛܠ ܡܪܢ ܘܨܠܘ ܥܠ ܡܪ̈ܘܗܝ ܡܛܠ ܚܘܒܐ
msItem.note: It contains, on the one side, a few words of the text, and the subscription. On the other side we find a note, stating that a person, whose name is suppressed, presented this book to the convent of S. Mary Deipara.

physDesc.p: The last leaf of a vellum manuscript, about 7 7/8 in. by 5.

handDesc.handNote: written in a good hand of the ixth or xth cent.

decoDesc.decoNote: Beneath the subscription there is a coloured ornament.

p.quote: ܠܬܫܒܘܚܬܐ ܕܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܩܕ[ܝܫܬܐ ܘܫܘܝܬ] ܒܐܘܣܝܐ. ܝܗ̣ܒ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܠܕܝܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܕ . . . ܡܫܝܚܐ ܝܕܥ̣ ܠܫܡܗ. ܡܛܠ ܦܘܪܩܢܐ ܕܢܦܫܗ ܘܕܘܟܪܢܐ ܕܥܢ̈ܝܕܘܗܝ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.quote: ......ης ενα θεον πατερα.......ρατορα πυητιν ουρανον κ γη........ωρατον κ παντον κ ορατον (sic) ....ης ενα κυριον ηεσον χριστον τον υον του θεου τον μονογεν.....

decoDesc.decoNote: On the verso (50 b) there are some rude attempts at ornamentation.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
